docs.text: how do films like mouse hunt get into theatres ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: isn't there a law or something ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this diabolical load of claptrap from steven speilberg's dreamworks studio is hollywood family fare at its deadly worst .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mouse hunt takes the bare threads of a plot and tries to prop it up with overacting and flat-out stupid slapstick that makes comedies like jingle all the way look decent by comparison .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: writer adam rifkin and director gore verbinski are the names chiefly responsible for this swill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot , for what its worth , concerns two brothers ( nathan lane and an appalling lee evens ) who inherit a poorly run string factory and a seemingly worthless house from their eccentric father .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: deciding to check out the long-abandoned house , they soon learn that it's worth a fortune and set about selling it in auction to the highest bidder .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but battling them at every turn is a very smart mouse , happy with his run-down little abode and wanting it to stay that way .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story alternates between unfunny scenes of the brothers bickering over what to do with their inheritance and endless action sequences as the two take on their increasingly determined furry foe .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: whatever promise the film starts with soon deteriorates into boring dialogue , terrible overacting , and increasingly uninspired slapstick that becomes all sound and fury , signifying nothing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script becomes so unspeakably bad that the best line poor lee evens can utter after another run in with the rodent is : " i hate that mouse " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is home alone all over again , and ten times worse .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one touching scene early on is worth mentioning .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we follow the mouse through a maze of walls and pipes until he arrives at his makeshift abode somewhere in a wall .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he jumps into a tiny bed , pulls up a makeshift sheet and snuggles up to sleep , seemingly happy and just wanting to be left alone .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a magical little moment in an otherwise soulless film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a message to speilberg : if you want dreamworks to be associated with some kind of artistic credibility , then either give all concerned in mouse hunt a swift kick up the arse or hire yourself some decent writers and directors .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this kind of rubbish will just not do at all .
docs.label: negative
